title: Say your damn role in Champ Select!
body:
Multiple times today this has happened. I am in champ select, last pick, when the DIana with smite says they're not jungling, and I have already picked a midlaner. Or the Lux running Flash Exhaust says she is going mid after I asked her five times where she is going before assuming support, and force locked in Xerath because I ran out of time. Even that Xin Zhao running TeleFlash that waits until all picks are locked in to switch to smite and tell Rammus he has to go top.


Moral of the story... Call your damn role.


Originally I was gonna make this a plea to Riot to implement something where when you pick your champion you also have to pick your role, and everyone on your team can see it. But I doubt they'd ever implement something so useful. So just say where you are going, please.

replies.body:
Sometimes I take smite on Sion top lane, just for the cinderhulk (and more objective control).

I always scream "TOP WITH SMITE" over and over again until the system prevents me from sending any more messages.

> [{quoted}](name=Puddinglax,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BcMlbT5G,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2015-03-24T00:18:07.771+0000)
>
> Sometimes I take smite on Sion top lane, just for the cinderhulk (and more objective control).
> 
> I always scream "TOP WITH SMITE" over and over again until the system prevents me from sending any more messages.

You're a good man/woman/possibly trained dog.
on the internet, no one knows you're a horse
can you explain why you go cinderhulk
Because it's OP af with his W passive. And nobody ever complains about a doublesmite for drags and barons.
Bronze elo does. "Why you run smite on support Sona?" "Because her Q range is longer than exhaust/ignite, and taking heal is bonkers"

There is no excuse for this. Not even Smite should excuse you from calling your role. There are all kinds of champs that can jungle, and for all we know, if you don't tell us, you could have just forgotten to change your summoner spells. There's always that last pick that instalocks hecarim when we already have Rammus and Sion on the team, and Rammus has smite and called it in chat. This is a PSA that a lot of people need to read.

Wait a second.  You want.... communication.... and teamwork.... in solo queue?

You have more faith in humanity than me.

I agree with this sentiment, but people shouldn't have to call out the obvious stuff either.  Having said that, there are some obvious indicators ...

* tp/flash for top lane
* smite for jungle
* ahri for mid
* leona for sup
* etc, etc, etc

I expect people in draft to have some basic knowledge of the game.  I don't expect everyone to call roles, but I do expect them to respond if asked.

Having said that, in 5.5 apparently everyone gets to jungle ... so I've seen Blanc, Fizz, Sion, etc be successful.  I've successfully done ad Malz too.  It's nice when people call out things like that, which aren't the norm.  I like to occasionally play Moa in the supp role against pull supps and mobile adcs.  I always call that out too.  Lastly, I always try to call out champs like Vlad that can top/mid, Zed who can top/mid or Quinn who can top/adc.

P.s. When I see someone pick Teemo or Poopy, I just cry and roll my face across the keyboard.  Just to be very clear, AP Teemo sucks hard if you ward and sweep.

You'd be shocked sometimes though.  I've had laners go into a ranked match with smite.  *sigh*

Also I had someone pick Poppy one time and I cried.  Then she carried hardcore.  *shrugs*
Hell, in the preseason, if you saw Warwick with Smite, 6 times out of 10 he was going top.

{{champion:78}}  top with {{summoner:11}} and {{item:3713}} might actually be the way you get lane {{champion:78}} to work, since her main weakness is a complete lack of wave clear, though Riot has stated that if anyone ever figured out how to make poppy work she would be nerfed immediately so I'm not sure how long it would last

but solo queue is where the real action happens 
* top lane warwick
* AD leona top
* akali jungle
* maybe even nautilus supp
* urgot anywhere
* the list goes on forever

LeBlanc ADC with Ahri Support. You wanna touch my adc? Heck naw. No, just go sit in that corner over there. Oh you think that magic resist will help? LB is ad and I'm true. Oh, cute some armor. Hug that corner some more. -.- crazy things.

Better yet, if you're 4th or 5th pick, LOOK AT WHAT CHAMPIONS HAVE ALREADY BEEN SELECTED. If Support and Mid are already covered, do not pick Support or Mid. If first pick got Jungler, and I see you sitting there after autolocking in Xin with Smite, my opinion of you has already dropped a few precious notches.

> [{quoted}](name=The5lacker,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BcMlbT5G,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-03-23T21:28:10.654+0000)
>
> Better yet, if you're 4th or 5th pick, LOOK AT WHAT CHAMPIONS HAVE ALREADY BEEN SELECTED. If Support and Mid are already covered, do not pick Support or Mid. If first pick got Jungler, and I see you sitting there after autolocking in Xin with Smite, my opinion of you has already dropped a few precious notches.

That is all well and good, but when someone picks a Lux with Flash Exhaust and you have spent the last two rotations asking them where they're going, and they say nothing so you lock in Xerath only to find that once everything is locked in they switch to ignite and say "Srry I had alt-tabbed, going mid lol." It is kinda annoying.

I'll say nothing and pick Kayle. Where is your god now. (Answer: jungle)

So when the xin changes to smite after everyone has locked in and that 2nd pick morgana wasnt going support...she was going top, and you couldnt tell because bronze supports and adc's take teleport because they are bad beyond belief...its my fault for not looking, eh?

ranked team builder is coming apparently. it would be queueing as your role tho, instead as a champion like the current team builder.

queue as support and then say you are going mid regardless... or at the very end you are a support akali or katarina (:

and then you get a week long ban, or more, because it's really fucking obvious if you queued for support then tried to get a different role

> [{quoted}](name=OJ191,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BcMlbT5G,comment-id=001200000000,timestamp=2015-03-24T04:18:20.144+0000)

except you won't
it doesn't even break rules, you can play any champion any role... by the rules

> [{quoted}](name=merrykitten,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BcMlbT5G,comment-id=0012000000000000,timestamp=2015-03-24T04:23:51.415+0000)

> it doesn't even break rules, you can play any champion any role... by the rules

Uh yes you would and should?

In normal queues sure, but if you queue up in a ROLE QUEUE you most certainly can be expected to play the lane/role you selected.

> [{quoted}](name=OJ191,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BcMlbT5G,comment-id=00120000000000000000,timestamp=2015-03-24T04:26:06.250+0000)
>
> Uh yes you would and should?
> 
> In normal queues sure, but if you queue up in a ROLE QUEUE you most certainly can be expected to play the lane/role you selected.

there is no list in the rules which champs should be played which roles
and then, to get any punishment, even a simple chat restriction, you should break rules a lot... like a lot, many dozens of games

Actually this is not true. It may not be a statute, but Riot has banned many people who have come on the boards to say that they thought they were allowed free will for whatever champion they picked.

There was a player about 1 year ago that got banned for a month because he picked Fiddle Support when it was already getting popular. He even posted the email responses saying that Riot found him to be trolling with his pick. They removed his post and when I checked weeks later he was still banned.

So technically as long as you do well, you'll be fine. But if you choose something unorthodox and it does not work, and you get reported, riot will act.

> [{quoted}](name=Orbv,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BcMlbT5G,comment-id=00120000000000000002,timestamp=2015-03-24T15:36:32.337+0000)
>

He even posted the email responses saying that Riot found him to be trolling with his pick. They removed his post and when I checked weeks later he was still banned.
> 
> So technically as long as you do well, you'll be fine. But if you choose something unorthodox and it does not work, and you get reported, riot will act.

The flipside is that if you don't ban people for consistently picking things their team does not approve of... Say Hi to lots of "support" Kats, duo mids etc.
You know what they say about assuming, its makes an ass of u and mi.

Yeah, I wish everyone would just call their roles, too.  I hate it when that Twitch that says nothing was actually jungle and then we have no adc and then he just afk's the whole game.  I think this kinda thing is ridiculous and should've been avoided.

And this is why I play teambuilder. For all its issues and the five hour wait-time for supports and junglers, it is **far** better than having some self-absorbed prick assuming he's more important than you as he switches to Jinx with 5 seconds left after you've had a marksman selected for the past 30 seconds.

What a load of fffffu-
fun.

> [{quoted}](name=The Blue Rooster,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BcMlbT5G,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-03-23T21:11:35.105+0000)
> 
> Originally I was gonna make this a plea to Riot to implement something where when you pick your champion you also have to pick your role, and everyone on your team can see it. But I doubt they'd ever implement something so useful.

It's called Team Builder... though instead of retards who don't call role you just get hideous queue time waiting for a support.
Talking gets you banned, communicating gets you banned, not communicating gets you banned, breathing gets you banned, calling a role gets you banned.

Wait you forgot...

* Picking {{champion:34}}{{champion:31}}{{champion:28}}{{champion:3}} 
* Not following a meta build path.
* Playing support with a bad ADC.
* Playing jungle with a bad team.
* Not buying {{item:2049}} as a jungler.
* Missing a skillshot.
* Playing jungle and clearing camps between ganks.

This could go on forever...

If I want to take unusual summoner spells for my role, I always just go with the "meta" summs but change them once everyone has locked in.  

Tele/Flash for top  
Ignite/Flash for mid  
Smite/Flash for jg  
Exhaust/Flash for support  
Heal/Flash for adc bot

and flash/flash for epileptics.

10/10 win rate every time.

I play support brand and here is what happens a lot of times:

Me: Support Brand
*last pick locks in alistair*

hmm... mid alistair ok why not
GAME STARTS

Alistair: wtf brand you're mid

but being mid is better

I don't do orthodox picks (minus ahri wherever the heck I please) often. So this sums my life. "Support Yasuo"...."Yasuo's not a support, go mid".... "Guise, trust me"..."Noob, someone dodge I don't wanna get leaverbusted for dodging"....I carry the game they all dodge and they watch as I obliterate their carries for giggles while my ADC eats tanks because I fed them. Sorry, was I ranting?

It's called team builder USE IT or stop whineing, why does raging shite with no purpose or presented solution get upvoted while logical discussions(as few as there are in this garbage community) get down voted into non exstance?.
He mentioned he was "last pick", so either he was in Normal Drafts or Ranked. Neither of these modes have Team Builder yet.
Despite what everyone is saying, if you get 2 people in one game doing this one of them is a troll.
SUPPORT! Always. {{champion:44}}

I think you should say what your main role is. So we can determine what's best for the team. I'd gladly play another role if I thought somebody could do it better than me. I main jungle, and my win rate out of the jungle in my division is pretty high. So I prefer to play jungle when I get into the lobby. I think it's essential calling your position when you play champs like Nidalee, Zed, Quinn, Maokai, Malphite, and Yasuo (to name a few) who can play Mid/Top/Jungle. This is confusing because sometimes you get two people who choose without communicating and then you get two people who readied up for mid lane and one is forced top vs their counter.

What if whe make syntax agreament:

* "^ Prefer this role"
* "= Can play this role"
* "~ Don't prefer this role" 

**Example**

* ^top^mid^jungle^adc^support
* =top=mid=jungle^adc^support
* -top^mid^jungle~adc~support
* ^support^adc ==~top

> [{quoted}](name=CoolKnightST,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BcMlbT5G,comment-id=0018,timestamp=2015-03-24T15:46:33.879+0000)
>
> What if whe make syntax agreament:
> 
> * "^ Prefer this role"
> * "= Can play this role"
> * "~ Don't prefer this role" 
> 
> **Example**
> 
> * ^top^mid^jungle^adc^support
> * =top=mid=jungle^adc^support
> * -top^mid^jungle~adc~support
> * ^support^adc ==~top

Um. I usually say 'adc > support > fill pref' meaning 'adc more than support more than fill pref'
People seem to understand this because it's pretty natural parsing. Nobody will naturally understand ^=~ .... they don't have good natural parsing. If you read '^adc=support~jungle' out loud you get 'carat adc equals support tilde jungle' .... what does that tell you? If you read 'adc > support > jungle' you get 'adc more than support more than jungle'. What does -that- tell you?

(Also this totally doesn't address the OP's problem. His problem is people not calling roles at all, not the syntax with which they call them.)

> [{quoted}](name=CoolKnightST,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BcMlbT5G,comment-id=0018,timestamp=2015-03-24T15:46:33.879+0000)
>
> What if whe make syntax agreament:
> 
> * "^ Prefer this role"
> * "= Can play this role"
> * "~ Don't prefer this role" 
> 
> **Example**
> 
> * ^top^mid^jungle^adc^support
> * =top=mid=jungle^adc^support
> * -top^mid^jungle~adc~support
> * ^support^adc ==~top

i won't remember and cannot parse all this regexp
I completely agree with you.  The amount of times I have dealt with this. My goddess tears are filling up!
